medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe mitral regurgitation following traumatic injury from a fall.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient fell from a height of 25 meters. Initially presented with closed head injury, right clavicular fracture, and multiple right-sided rib fractures with pneumo- and hemothorax. Symptoms related to mitral regurgitation were noted during hospitalization, with a loud holosystolic murmur detected before discharge. At evaluation 6 months after the accident, the patient reported no cardiopulmonary symptoms and could hike 5 to 7 miles without dyspnea or fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Normal transthoracic echocardiogram 5 years before the accident; no previous relevant medical history specified.
